intro: Stachytarpheta lythrophylla, commonly known as the coastal stachytarpheta, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are usually violet or purple in color. Stachytarpheta lythrophylla is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to withstand salty air and wind.
